sect3.title: Config files
sect3.para: leafnode may be configured to use inetd by adding a leafnode entry to the /etc/inetd.conf file with the following command:
Alternatively, leafnode may be configured to use xinetd by adding a leafnode entry to the /etc/xinetd.conf file with the following command:

userinput.command: cat >> /etc/xinetd.conf << "EOF" service nntp { flags = NAMEINARGS NOLIBWRAP socket_type = stream protocol = tcp wait = no user = news server = /usr/sbin/tcpd server_args = /usr/sbin/leafnode instances = 7 per_source = 3 } EOF

sect3.para: The /etc/news/config file must be edited to reflect the name of the upstream NNTP provider. Copy the example configuration file to /etc/news/config and save the original for reference:
